messages.subject: Re: New old sword help
messages.msgSnippet: ... may ... found it ... shaped ... or ... goes ... rust on ... anything... ... where would ya send a sword to have it done & whats the fee ? if ya get on
messages.messageBody:
--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, Andres Pedraza <apedraza93@...>
wrote:
>
> Rust does not come off with a cleaning. It need a polish done by
> someone properly trained in that art, and with the proper supplies.
> Attempting to do it yourself will ruin the sword and any value it
may
> have. Without looking at the sword, or at least a few good pictures
> of it, no one can tell you what it is (Japanese or otherwise), nor
> how old. With pictures some might venture a guess, but for a real
> opinion you'll need to take it to someone who knows nihonto so they
> can examine it.
>
> Best,
>
> Andres
>

>

found it

shaped

or

rust on
> >it but not pitted anywhere... how do i clean off the rust and what
> >parts of the sword can i clean without ruining its value if it has
> >any ? havent done anything to it as far as trying to clean
anything...
> >only took off the handle to look...
> >
> >
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] New old sword help
messages.msgSnippet: Rust does not come off with a cleaning. It need a polish done by someone properly trained in that art, and with the proper supplies. Attempting to do it
messages.messageBody:
Rust does not come off with a cleaning. It need a polish done by
someone properly trained in that art, and with the proper supplies.
Attempting to do it yourself will ruin the sword and any value it may
have. Without looking at the sword, or at least a few good pictures
of it, no one can tell you what it is (Japanese or otherwise), nor
how old. With pictures some might venture a guess, but for a real
opinion you'll need to take it to someone who knows nihonto so they
can examine it.

Best,

Andres

At 03:33 PM 2/22/2009, you wrote:

>I just got a japanese sword... me friend bought a old house & found it
>in the basement with some other old japanese things... i took the
>bamboo pins our & removed the handle & there is a line of japanese
>wrighting on both sides of the tang... the hand guard is iron shaped
>like a 4 petaled flower sort of... no other metal on the scabbard or
>handle other than the guard & a peice what looks like gold that goes
>over the blade just in front of the guard... the blade has some rust on
>it but not pitted anywhere... how do i clean off the rust and what
>parts of the sword can i clean without ruining its value if it has
>any ? havent done anything to it as far as trying to clean anything...
>only took off the handle to look...
>
>
